page.title: 06A DINNER LADY REMEMBERS 1
page.content: MRS.BARKSBY,A DINNER LADY FROM BAMFORD SCHOOL WAS INTERVIEWED BY VICKY E FIONA H AND FIONA T THERE ARE HUNDREDS MORE PEOPLE AND A LOT MORE BUILDINGS . THERE ARE ABOUT A THOUSAND MORE PEOPLE LIVE IN BAMFORD TODAY. YORKSHIRE BRIDGE WEST LEES AND BRENTWOOD ARE A FEW OF THE NEW ESTATES.MRS OLLERENSHAW HAS WORKED AT THE SCHOOL THE LONGEST. CLOUGH HOUSE HAS A LOT OF HISTORY.THE LAND IS USED FOR GRAZING. THE POST OFFICE USED TO BE A BUTCHERS SHOP BEFORE IT WAS A POST OFFICE,LIKE IT IS TODAY. THE CATHOLIC CHURCH USED TO BE A CATHOLIC SCHOOL.AND THERE ARE TWO OTHER CHURCHES, THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND THE METHODIST CHAPEL. THE MAN WHO BUILT THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND WAS A SQUIRE AND BUILT THE BAMFORD MILL.THERE WERE FOUR GROCERY SHOPS,THE SHOP THAT IS PAM AND
